bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, October 27, 1951

div1.p: Rojas writes that she is glad to know Hench is coming to Havana because there are matters she wishes to discuss with him. She provides information on Cuban hotels and informs him that she will soon be in New York.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, October 27, 1951 See Spanish original.
div1.opener:
October 27, 1951
Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I am very glad to know that you intend to come to Havana in the
month of January because in that way I shall have the opportunity to speak
about some matters that I wish to talk about with you.

I have been inquiring about the hotels of Varadero, and they
inform me that the Hotel Intermaciomal is by far the best. The prices:
a double room from $21 up per day without meals. The Hotel Rosa is, on
the other hand, a modest but comfortable hotel and the prices: $25 per
day for a double room with meals. There is also the Kawama Club which
had independent cottages and is well patronized. If you are interested
in it I can inquire.

I intend to leave for New York within a few days to spend
a few weeks of rest there but I will be back in Havana on that date.
My address in New York will be the Gotham Hotel, 5th Avenue at 55th
Street. If you have to go there before the end of December don't
fail to advise me.
Many affectionate regards fromfor Mrs. Hench.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Mona Teresa Rojas Translated by Gordon Harrison/mh 11-5-51
